DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether monthly subcutaneous administration LBR-101 safe provide migraine prevention subject high frequency episodic migraine .
DOC.brief_title: A Multicenter Assessment LBR-101 High Frequency Episodic Migraine
DOC.criteria: Males female age 18 65 year age . A signed date informed consent document indicate subject inform pertinent aspect study include know potential risk available alternative treatment . Subjects fulfil criterion episodic migraine per Second Edition The International Headache Society ( Olesen Steiner 2004 ) , experience migraine high frequency follow : . History headaches 8 day per month least 3 month prior screen ii . Verification headache frequency prospectively collect baseline information 28day runin phase demonstrate headache ( type ) least 8 day total 8 14 days* fulfil criterion migraine . *Operational definition migraine probable migraine day present statistical section protocol . Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 17.5 37.5 kg/m2 , total body weight 50 kg 120 kg , inclusive . Demonstrated compliance electronic headache diary runin period entry headache data minimum 22/28 day ( 80 % compliance ) . Subject receive onabotulinum toxin A migraine medical cosmetic reason require injection head , face , neck six month prior screen . Subject uses medication contain opioids ( include codeine ) barbiturate ( include Fiorinal® , Fioricet® , combination contain butalbital ) 4 day per month treatment migraine reason . Failed > 2 medication category > 3 preventive medication ( within two medication category ) due lack efficacy prophylactic treatment episodic chronic migraine adequate therapeutic trial Treatment investigational drug device within 30 day study entry prior exposure monoclonal antibody target CGRP pathway .
